title: [Neuroscience] Education may be the best way to protect against cognitive decline. Researchers suspect the reason people with a college degree do better cognitively in their 50s is they are more likely to end up with a career that makes them use their brains.

[Health] Long-term air pollution exposure raises depression risk. Scientists observed statistically significant harmful associations between long-term exposure to elevated levels of air pollution and increased risk of late-life depression diagnosis
